New Records: Spencer Horwitz recorded his first career four-hit game and his second multi-homer game of his career.
José Berríos earned his 15th win of the season, tying for the third-most in the Majors.
Key Match Events: Spencer Horwitz hit two home runs and drove in three runs, leading the Blue Jays' offensive eruption.
José Berríos allowed one run over six innings, contributing to the Blue Jays' victory.
Pre-Game Insights: Blue Jays manager John Schneider noted Horwitz's strong performance and hinted at future matchups, especially against left-handed pitchers like Chris Sale.
Post-Match Reflections: Spencer Horwitz credited his success to his work with assistant hitting coach Matt Hague and expressed gratitude for the opportunity to play for the Blue Jays.
José Berríos celebrated his 15th win, emphasizing the importance of team victories over individual statistics.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was played at Truist Park, with no significant weather conditions impacting the match.
